column2: All LEDs light, but nothing displays on LCD and printer will not operate.
Main Logic Board or EPROM faulty.
Insure EPROMs properly installed or Replace the Main Logic Board.
Buffer Empty LED turns OFF after 15 sec. but all other LEDs stay ON
Main Logic Board Dynamic RAM faulty.
Replace Main Logic Board
ONAll LEDs flash ON and OFF
No significant amount of DRAM tested good
Replace the main logic board,
Take Label LED Flashing
Printer Misconfigured for Peel- Off Mode
If Peel-Off is desired, check Take Label Sensor
Printer locks up while running Power On Self Test
Main logic Board failure
Replace Main Logic Board
CHECKSUM FOR ROM SET INVALlD
A ROM checksum is incorrect.
Turn the printer OFF and then ON. If the fault reoccurs, replace the main logic board
EEPROM CHECKSUM INVALID
EEPROM checksum is incorrect
Replace the main logic board.
ERROR CONDITION PAPER OUT
Printer stops. PAPER OUT and PAUSE LED ON. No media loaded or incorrectly loaded. Misadjusted Media Sensor
Load media correctly.
ERROR CONDITION RIBBON OUT
Printer stops. RIBBON OUT and PAUSE LED ON. No ribbon loaded or incorrectly loaded. Ribbon Sensor not sensing ribbon that is loaded correctly. Misadiusted Ribbon Sensor
Load ribbon correctly. Check Ribbon Sensor operation. Adjust if necessary
ERROR CONDITION HEAD OPEN
Printer stops. HEAD OPEN LED Flashes and PAUSE LED ON. Printhead is not fully closed. Head Open Sensor not detecting Flag or Flag not in proper position.
Close printhead completely. Check Head Open Sensor and Flag for proper operation.
ERROR CONDITION HEAD OVER TEMP
Printer stops and PAUSE LED flashes. Printhead element is overheated.
Printer resumes printing when the printhead element cools
ERROR CONDITION HD ELEMENT FAIL
Printhead element going bad - experiencing print quality problems.
To override this message, (1) place JT 0 in your format and then (2) JO to turn off the HEAD TEST. Clean printhead and test for proper printing. Replace printhead if necessary
ERROR CONDITION CUTTER JAMMED
Cutter blade in media path
Turn the power off. Remove the media, reload the media and turn power on. If the error condition still exists, check cutter sensors and control board. Replace if necessary.
ERROR CONDITION CALIBRATE ERROR
Loss of registration indicating a media sensor problem. Printer set for non-continuous media, but continuous media loaded.
Adjust media sensor position and then, if needed, adjust the media sensor sensitivity. Set printer for correct media
OUT OF MEMORY DOWNLOAD GRAPHIC or OUT OF MEMORY GREATING BIT MAP

Printer stops and PAUSE LED lights. Not enough memory to perform function shown in second line. Functions: Download Graphics Creating Bitmap (not enough memory for length of label) Building Format (label too complex).

You may do any of the following: 1. Check for proper Communication Configuration 2. With PAUSE ON, use -HM to display the amount of memory free. 3. Press PAUSE to skip that download and continue to next one. 4. With PAUSE ON, press CANCEL and the printer stops. 5. Turn Power OFF to Clear printer memory and Start again. 6. Set max label length correctly.
Poor Print Quality.
Burn Temperature too . low. Incorrect Media and Ribbon. Printhead Adjustments incorrect.
Increase Burn Temperature. Replace Media and Ribbon. Perform required adjustments.
Truncated print, no print or Feed button operates incorrectly while using non-continuous media

Maximum label length parameter set less than parameter set less than , the actual label length. Printer, that is in rewind or peel off mode, was powered ON without media or backing around rewind spindle.
Set the correct label length. Load media correctly for rewind or peel off mode
Long tracks of missing print on several labels
Wrinkled ribbon. Print Element damaged.
See Wrinkled Ribbon in this Table. Replace printhead.
Fine gray lines on blank labels at angles
Wrinkled ribbon
See Wrinkled Ribbon in this Table.
Wrinkled ribbon
Ribbon fed through machine incorrectly. Incorrect burn temperature. Incorrect printhead pressure or balance. Media not feeding properly; it is walking from side to side.

Load ribbon correctly. Set the burn temperature to the lowest setting possible for good print quality. Set the pressure to the minimum needed. See Printhead Balance Adjustment and Printhead Pressure Adjustment procedures. Make sure that the media is snug by adjusting the media guide
Continued wrinkled ribbon

Strip plate needs adjusting. Ribbon supply tension needs adjusting. Printhead shaft needs adjusting using the wear plate. Printhead needs ealigning with platen roller. Ribbon take up tension. needs adjusting to the minimum value. 3 point mount for ribbon supply spindle needs adjusting Ribbon supply core slipping; spindle blades need adjusting
Perform adjustments.
Light printing or no printing on the left or right side of the label.
Printhead needs balancing. Printhead shaft needs adjusting using the wear plate.
Perform Wear. Plate adjustment.
Mis-regis tration/Skips Labels
Misadjusted Media Sensors. Improper Spindle Tensions. Improper ZPL Format
Perform Media Sensor Adjustments. Perform Spindle Adjustments. Correct ZPL Format
Misregistration and misprint of 1 to 3 labels
Media was pulled when motor was not moving. Printer, that is in rewind or peel off mode, was powered ON without media or backing around rewind spindle. Misadjusted Media Sensor.
Open and close the printhead, so it calibrates to find the label length. Place Media Sensor in proper position.
Vertical drift in top-ofform registration.
A plus or minus 4-6 dot row (approx. 1/2mm) vertical drift is possible due to the different tolerances of the mechanical parts and printer modes.
Use Top Position setting to correct.
Label jam in rear area of printhead.
Upper Media Plate (Snap plate) needs cleaning
Clean Upper Media Plate (Snap Plate).
Print label feeds out and then backfeeds immediately resting under the printhead
Printer set for cutter mode with no cutter installed.
Set correct print mode.
Changes in parameter settings did not take effect.
Parameters are set incorrectly. If problem continues, there may be a problem on main logic board.
Cycle the power. Reload factory defaults,, Then, set parameters and save permanently. Replace the main logic board.
Missing LCD characters or parts of characters
LCD may need replacing
Run the Power On Self Test and check that LCD display is showing all characters.
ZPL was sent to printer, but not recognized. Buffer light remains ON.
Communications parameters are incorrect. Prefix and delimiter characters set in printer do not match the ones used in ZPL.

Print a Communications Diagnostic Label. Check for Format or Overrun Errors. Reset Communication parameters. Set the characters in the printer to match ZPL format. If problem continues, check the ZPL format for changed CC, CT, and ACD
